content.description: A sample of 100 students from Liberty High School and a sample of 60 students from Central High School were asked what they planned to do after graduation. Responses fell into five categories: four-year university <math alttext="4 Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>(4Y)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, community college <math alttext="C C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>(CC)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, join the workforce <math alttext="W" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>(W)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, join the military <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>(M)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, or undecided <math alttext="U D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>(UD)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. The results are shown in the following bar chart.
content.question: Which of the following statements is supported by the bar chart?

choices.label: For the category four-year university, the number of students from Central High School was 10 greater than the number of students from Liberty High School.
At Liberty High School, more students selected a four-year university than any other activity.
For the category join the workforce, the number of students from each school was equal.
At Central High School, the same number of students selected four-year university and military.
For the category undecided, the number of students from Liberty High School was 4 greater than the number of students from Central High School.

content.answer: For the category undecided, the number of students from Liberty High School was 4 greater than the number of students from Central High School.

topic.text: 1.4: Representing a Categorical Variable with Graphs

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Compare distributions or relative positions of points within a distribution.
